title: Poison, coins and lullabies … New Andron fonts released
content:
A couple of new fonts are now available as a part of the greater Andron family.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112224im_/http:/typophile.com/files/schild_Andron_1_ALC_3_T_6332.png)
  
 [Andron 1 Alchemical](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112224/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/andreas-stotzner/andron-1-alchemical/) – a special supplement font

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112224im_/http:/typophile.com/files/schild_Andron_1_MON_2_T_6194.png)
  
 [Andron 1 Monetary](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112224/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/andreas-stotzner/andron-1-monetary/) – a special supplement font with old and brandnew currency signs

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112224im_/http:/typophile.com/files/schild_Andron_2_ABC_T_6494.png)
  
 [Andron 2 ABC](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112224/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/andreas-stotzner/andron-2-abc/) – for children’s books
author: Andreas Stötzner

comments.content: Just wanted to say "Great work". Both because these look fantastic, and that you took the time to make the unusual, little-used characters.
Really impressive! Also, it never occurred to me to design supplement fonts but it's a brilliant idea. Is there a longer history to this principle? I've never seen supplement fonts like these before.

These alchemical/astrological and monetarian character sets are actually a part of Andron Mega. I extracted them and put them into extra fonts because sometimes they are needed for specialized editing work. For those who need such characters but do not want to purchase Andron Mega. A few years ago I did the same with [Andron Publix](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112224/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/andreas-stotzner/andron-corpus-publix/).  
I also consider to release even more character sets out of Andron Mega as seperate fonts, e.g. Runic.
